title: The Great Gatsby
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
description: A novel set in the Roaring Twenties that tells the story of Jay Gatsby's unrequited love for Daisy Buchanan.

title: To Kill a Mockingbird
author: Harper Lee
description: A coming-of-age story that explores themes of racial injustice and moral growth in the American South.

author: George Orwell
description: A dystopian novel that delves into the dangers of totalitarianism and extreme political ideology.

title: Pride and Prejudice
author: Jane Austen
description: A romantic novel that critiques the British landed gentry at the end of the 18th century.

title: The Catcher in the Rye
author: J.D. Salinger
description: A story about teenage angst and alienation, narrated by the iconic character Holden Caulfield.

title: The Hobbit
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
description: A fantasy novel that follows the journey of Bilbo Baggins as he embarks on an adventure with a group of dwarves.

title: Fahrenheit 451
author: Ray Bradbury
description: A novel that presents a future society where books are banned and 'firemen' burn any that are found.

title: The Alchemist
author: Paulo Coelho
description: A philosophical book that tells the story of Santiago, a shepherd boy who dreams of finding treasure.
